comments:
On AS/400, upon calling initialize() of the RemoteComponentSkeleton class, an
AgentControllerUnavailableException was thrown.  This problem was encounterd
using the Hyades test programs TestProgram.java and TestAgent.java (under
org.eclipse.hyades.tests/org.eclipse.haydes.use.cases/src in the
dev.eclipse.org:/home/tools CVS respository) on a V5R2 testing system.  The
command used was:

java -Djava.version=1.4 -classpath
/opt/hyadesdc/plugins/org.eclipse.hyades.execution_4.0.0/hexr.jar:/opt/hyadesdc/plugins/org.eclipse.hyades.execution_4.0.0/hexl.jar:.
TestProgram

and the exeption received was:

org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.remote.AgentControllerUnavailableException
                                                                         
        at java/lang/Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java:180)                    
        at java/lang/Exception.<init>(Exception.java:29)                     
        at
org/eclipse/hyades/internal/execution/remote/AgentControllerUnavailableException.<init>(AgentControllerUnavailableException.java:26)
          
        at
org/eclipse/hyades/internal/execution/remote/RemoteComponentSkeleton.initialize(RemoteComponentSkeleton.java:360)
                             
        at TestAgent.<init>(TestAgent.java:26)                               
        at TestProgram.main(TestProgram.java:7)                              
PID:      0                                                                  
Agent:    Agent1                                                             
RAC Port: null                                                               
DEBUG: Sent 0 bytes                                                          
DEBUG: Sent 0 bytes

The agent controller was running at the time, as the 'Test' operation to the
host returned sucessfully.

The problem was reproduced on Linux (RedHat Linux Enterprise Server 3 AS Update
3).  In both cases, the TPTP 4.0 driver used was the latest stable driver:
TPTP-4.0.0-200507141319.

A brief testing on a different RH3AS U3 system couldn't reproduce the problem. 
Suspected that it was caused by a tainted testing environment in the case of a
Linux system.

I cannot reproduce the problem on our iSeries V5R2 system. The exception you are
getting looks like you haven't set the "QIBM_MULTI_THREADED=Y" environment in
qshell.

Yes, the environment variable appeared to have solve the problem.  Shouldn't
this be documented in the installation guide with a brief explanation of what
the variable does?
A readme entry has been added to the release notes.
